comment: Tests are 75% of your grade and are every other week over 50-60 slide ppts. Exams are very difficult and are hard to study for. I learned how to study fo this class too late and it cost me. He is a funny guy and makes class enjoyable, but he does swear a lot and goes off topic frequently. Extremely hard class so prepare to study a lot.

Really funny and tells stories however, tests are hard. Lots of material (ppts are 50-60 slides long with chunks of info), a lot of mastering hw. He is available for office hours and will try to help students out but due to the nature of his teaching it is sometimes hard to retain information. Especially when tests are every other week.
hes a funny and good professor but his exams are super hard. the exams barely have anything to do with the lectures. he does let you retake 2 exams at the end of the semester though

You would be shooting yourself in the foot not taking him for genetics. He is so funny and his class is very easy. 12 exams, each over 1-2 chapters and mastering homework for grade. Retake 2 exams and only need to do so much homework for full credit. The grading scale was adjusted but honestly its easy to get an A with minimal effort with him. TAKE

Probably the best genetics professor there is. Lectures were pre-recorded and very detailed along with the powerpoints. There is a test every week and its only over 1 chapter so its not overwhelming. 2 lowest test grades are dropped, and mastering hw is due at the end of the semester. The least stressful class i had all semester.

Professor Nowak has amazing lectures! He always likes to tell stories, sometimes they might relate to the material. Great analogies for people who like those. Very simple expectations for exams. Nothing too complicated or complex, just wants you to understand the fundamentals. 12 exams, 2 dropped. Allowed 200 pts on Mastering HW, graded on 100 pts.

Listen to the other reviews. This guy asks trick questions on the tests and it's really not cool. He lectures on one thing, mastering homework is another thing, and then his tests are different than both of those.

I love this guy! He is very funny and will happily spend lecture time working over the questions you have. For online you do the notes/HW then go to a lecture time to ask questions or just chat about life. 12 Tests and he drops 2 and aren't terribly difficult if you took notes. Don't let the number of tests freak you out. Treat them like a quiz.

Really funny professor and very understanding. Is willing to work with you and understands that life happens. Tests are kinda hard but its just a lot of studying has to go into it to do well. He has an adjusted grading scale (88.5 and above is an A, 78.5 is a B, and so on) and bumps your grade an overall 3% if you do the hw and you show up.

Funny guy, hard class. The tests are awful and do not relate to any of the content and are VERY confusingly worded. Great because you just need an 88.5 to get an A in his class but it's very hard to get that.

He basically reads notes from the PowerPoint and talks about other things. But isnt really clear about whats on the test. I never made good grades on the tests except for 1. His tests are mostly different from the PowerPoints. I dont know where he gets those questions from. Im use to making As and Bs but i made a C in this class.

Funniest professor I have had. His lectures are clear, concise, and actually enjoyable. Exams are difficult but you can get an A with moderate effort. Grade consists of 4 exams total, no final, online quizzes, and mastering hw.

Nowak is the best professor I have ever had. I pretty much only used his powerpoints and mastering to study for his tests and I got an A (I never read the textbook). He's hilarious and he makes a boring subject interesting. He also curves your grade by 2.5% if you do all the mastering and come to 90% of lectures. Highly recommend him for genetics!

This man is hilarious and when you make a subject funny it's a thousand times easier. He's also nice so it's easy to ask him questions, and he knows his stuff. His lectures are a breeze. As long as you study his powerpoints in depth, pay attention in lecture, and do the homework, you'll pass. Do it all well and you'll get an easy A.

Dr. Nowak is a great professor but you need to be prepared to do a good amount of studying outside class. He doesn't always go in depth enough or explain a specific topic well enough so I watched youtube videos reviewing concepts we learned in class and did well that way. He assigns mastering hw and if you do it all he'll curve your grade 2.5%.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hilarious and approachable, will answer questions. The class itself is tough! Be ready to study. Attendance is optional, but it benefits to be there! And he does have pop quizzes, but 4 of 10 are dropped. Homework you only have to get to 100 points, which is easily attainable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: PRINT OUT THE LECTURES & GO OVER THEM. DO ALL OF THE MASTERING HW BC HE BUMPS THE FINAL GRADE BY 2.5%. GO TO HIS OFFICE IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS. LOOK OVER PREVIOUS EXAMS & MAKE SURE YOU UNDERSTAND THE QUESTIONS YOU'VE MISSED. LASTLY, ENJOY WHAT YOU'RE LEARNING. HE MAKES YOU WORK FOR YOUR GRADE, BUT IT'S WORTH IT. WORK HARD AND YOU'LL GET AN "A" .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is not easy! However, he curves his overall grades (i.e an A is a 100-85 B 84-75 etc). He's a funny professor and will make witty analogies in class. The questions on his test were very complex. You must do the homework and read to understand the material better. Go to SI sessions and his office if you have questions.

Good professor, but goes super fast over his lecture slides. Before & after class, go over the slides bc he loves pop quizzes. IF YOU'RE NOT UNDERSTANDING A CONCEPT, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. trust me.  DO NOT OVERTHINK the exams. There's Mastering for HW, which is due on the day of the exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you need to take genetics then take it with Nowak. He won't just give you an A but he'll make make you curios enough about the subject to want to earn it. He gives conscious  and inspired lectures with great energy. Ask questions and do the homework. Also, take advantage of SI.

Took Nowak for genetics, even though this course was tough & took much of my time, it was one of the best classes I have ever taken. I studied his power points & read the book. Make sure you go to class!!! But I would also go to him for questions. If you have any ASK HIM. He does great with explaining & is super helpful! Great teacher!

LOVED THIS CLASS! This is a very hard course if you slack, but if you read the book and ask questions if you don't understand then it's pretty easy. He is always willing to help/ explain differently. Great sense of humor; if you get offended easily don't take. A lot of material, reading helps & doing mastering. Will bump your grade if on the line!!
This man is awesome. He is so understanding. He is def one of my fave professors in ksu. He also tried to pronounce my name till he got it right, he has a great sense of humor too. I love him.

Confusing lectures, not clear on what he wants you to know. Doesn't post lecture slides until 10 minutes before lecture. Omits a lot of from book but won't tell you "recommended reading" so you have to guess or read it all anyway. Most students couldn't finish tests without rushing, VERY long tests and long multiple choice. Kind of unreasonable
Nowak is awesome.  He's like my favorite geek on my favorite show, Big Bang Theory.  I love geeks, and his collection of star wars dollies in his office is a HUGE turn on.  Love this guy!

Dr Nowak is an average professor, he is knowledgeable but his lecturing technique is not effective. I would not recommend him, this is not a class in which you can make an A, even if you knew and remembered everything. tests seem easy, but when you get your grade you're like huh?

Dr. Nowak is my favorite professor at KSU. He will stop in the middle of a lecture to answer questions or to clarify the material. He goes over every test and quiz in class to make sure we understand the material. Dr. Nowak is very interesting and passionate about the material. The class is very fast and you can't get behind, but he is the best.

Dr. Nowak is by far the best professor I've ever had at KSU. I was very close to changing my major from bio to genetics after attending his course. He keeps it upbeat and interesting. He's funny and great at holding the classes attention. He has the best and most eye opening metaphors that make the information easy to understand :)

I almost didn't take genetics with him because of what I heard from other students. Im so glad I didn't listen to them and took genetics with him this semester. He wants you to do well and always answers any questions. The class is difficult because it covers so much but if you study you will do fine. He's a nice guy but you have to earn your grade

If you want to learn something in college, TAKE HIM. Its a hard class, hard content, but he does everthing in his power to help you. Very laidback professor, genuinely cares about his students. Tests are hard, but if you go to class and know wverything on his slides, you'll do fine.

If you liked Biochem thi class with rock.  Such a facinating class.  The Prof gives you every opportunity to really understand the material.  The lab was reworked this semester so it was kinda spotty but he was super helpful about clarification. Take him if you can for this class, you will not be disappointed!

Amazing prof that really wants his students to succeed. Gives you his slides, KNOW these for tests. I got an A just reading the suggested reading, studying his slides, and the web required practice.  More than willing ot help you understand.
He genuinely cares about students, amazing professor, just read chapters before hand, pay attention in class and you'll be fine. Already signed up for his other class, highly recommended
Take him if you can. Lectures are very helpful, he's very clear about what he expects from you on tests, overall had a good experience with him and would definitely take him again.

Dr. Nowak was only a substitute lecturer for my class and lab for a single day, but I learned more from him and took such incredible noted in just that one class with him than I have all semester with my current professor. He is extremely helpful and is genuinely passionate about his field of study and the success of his students. Highly recommen

His classes are alot of fun, lab as well. However you do need to study this certainly isnt a breeze through class. He has officer hours, but comes to meet students outside them for help if they need it. I really enjoyed the class. Hope you enjoy it to.

Very nice professor but his tests are very hard! He gives homework and has many grades in lab but you have to read the book chapters before class in order to have a chance at understanding. Studying is mandatory!!!! Lab is laid back but he will disect all lab write ups, so make sure you abide by the grading guidelines
